description: Agent skill rules for generating code in MiniGame module. Machine-readable naming and style rules.

rules.title: Function parameters must start with functionParamPrefix
rules.note: Apply to all functions (methods, free functions, lambdas parameters where practical).

rules.title: Local variables must start with localVarPrefix
Class and struct naming
rules.note: All user-defined classes must start with 'c'. All structs must start with 's'.

rules.title: Global variables
rules.note: Avoid globals when possible; if used follow prefix.

rules.title: Include guard style
rules.note: Do not use old-style #ifndef/#define header guards.

rules.title: Variable naming with scope and type prefixes
rules.note: Variable name must start with a scope prefix (m_/l_/g_), then a type prefix (i for int, db for double, f for float, i64 for int64, str for string, etc.), then the identifier where the first character is UpperCase (e.g. m_iValue, l_fSpeed, g_i64Counter).

examples.classExample: class cExample { private: int m_iCount; public: cExample(int e_iInit); void Update(int e_iDelta); };
examples.structExample: struct sResult { bool m_bOk; int m_iValue; };
